channel.title: ItemDef.java [PI]
channel.description:
i was looking in the ItemDef.java and found some cool things like "pkers cape" and things
but when i spawn them they are invisible does anyone know why?

item.title: ItemDef.java [PI]
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

If you’re trying to add the capes I’m thinking of, which is just the Fire cape with different sprites used, you should already have the models for the cape itself. As for the sprite ‘flowing’ down the cape, that is handled in your client class. If you want an example, take a look at Overload-X.

Read full topic

item.title: ItemDef.java [PI]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

mrnessie:

i have a problem like this except the problem is that my itemdef.java is “encrypted” well thats what my friend said. he said it means i cant add my ints in it. when i try i get 100 errors. annoyed the crap outta me yesterday

I don’t believe it’s encrypted. You probably have an ItemDef_1.java, that’s what you’ll have to add it to

Edit: OP: You can probably find these models online.

Read full topic

item.title: ItemDef.java [PI]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“erlasz, post:5, topic:520265”]how do i find out if i have the correct models?

thanks for the help man

edit just checked the models and the id is not in there how do i made a model for it?[/quote]
Get Metasequoia and design the models. Then convert the .mq’s to .dat’s using DATmaker.

Read full topic

item.description:

item.title: ItemDef.java [PI]
item.dc:creator: @erlasz erlasz
item.description:
@erlasz wrote:

this is the item but it comes out all weird its a dragon fire cape here is the ItemDef
case 15284:
itemDef.name = “@red@Dragon Cape”;
itemDef.actions = new String[5];
itemDef.actions[1] = “Wear”;
itemDef.originalModelColors= new int[1];
itemDef.modifiedModelColors = new int[1];
itemDef.originalModelColors[0] = 40;
itemDef.modifiedModelColors[0] = 34;
itemDef.modelID = 9631;
itemDef.modelZoom = 2040;
itemDef.modelRotation1 = 545;
itemDef.modelRotation2 = 2;
itemDef.modelOffset2 = 5;
itemDef.modelOffset1 = 4;
itemDef.anInt204 = 0;
itemDef.maleEquip1 = 9638;
itemDef.femaleEquip1 = 9640;
itemDef.description = “A rare cape with liquid dragon flowing down it.”.getBytes();
break;

case 15285:
itemDef.name = “@blu@Water cape”;
itemDef.actions = new String[5];
itemDef.actions[1] = “Wear”;
itemDef.originalModelColors= new int[1];
itemDef.modifiedModelColors = new int[1];
itemDef.originalModelColors[0] = 40;
itemDef.modifiedModelColors[0] = 17;
itemDef.modelID = 9631;
itemDef.modelZoom = 2040;
itemDef.modelRotation1 = 545;
itemDef.modelRotation2 = 2;
itemDef.modelOffset2 = 5;
itemDef.modelOffset1 = 4;
itemDef.anInt204 = 0;
itemDef.maleEquip1 = 9638;
itemDef.femaleEquip1 = 9640;
itemDef.description = “A rare cape of water.”.getBytes();
break;

and it looks like this…

plus they both hold in the wepon slot?
can you help please!

Read full topic

item.title: ItemDef.java [PI]
item.dc:creator: @mr_extremez mr extremez
item.description:
@mr_extremez wrote:

Make sure you have the models, the correct ints in itemdef.java and add them to item.cfg in your source.
